document_data.name: Garras
document_data.mainbody: '''Garras''' was the elven ghost beloved of [[Elena]] whose final resting place in [[Myth Drannor]] was disturbed in [[1369 DR]].
document_data.Possessions:
''[[Elena's pewter locket]]'' was a delicate magical amulet that she gifted to her beloved at some point before their deaths. The item possessed enchantment that increased the wearer's wisdom and intelligence.

''[[Garras' Keen Sight]]'' was a unique magic ring in Garras' possession before his death.
document_data.Relationships: Garras' lover Elena was haunting [[Turgild's Square]] in [[Dwarven Dungeons]]' of Myth Drannor.
document_data.History:
In [[1369 DR]], Elena encountered the adventurers from [[Phlan]] seeking to stop the [[Cult of the Dragon]] plan of corrupting the elven city's ''[[mythal]]''. She asked them to restore the magical mechanism that powered her favorite fountains by defeating a powerful [[iron golem|dwarven statue golem]] called the [[Lifespring Guardian]] in the [[Deep Halls]] She also left heroes with a cryptic message that led them to restore the dignity and sanctity of Garras' and her own final resting places.

The lovers' restless spirits lent their strength to the battle with the Guardian. Subsequently, the heroes defeated the [[golem]], sending Elena and Garras into the afterlife.
